intro: Cistus mutabilis, commonly known as the variable rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its evergreen shrub form and hairy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, depending on the stage of bloom. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for rocky or coastal environments. Cistus mutabilis is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
